question: In Mr. Smith's class of 57 students, 29% of the class are soccer players. Out of the remaining class, 39% of the students are dancers or part of debate team members. These 3 groups of students will need to leave early today to travel to an away tournament. How many students are leaving early?
answer:
29% of the 57 student class are soccer players so that's 0.29*57 = <<0.29*57=16>>16 students
There are 57 students and 16 are soccer players so that leaves 57-16 = <<57-16=41>>41 students
39% of the remaining 41 students are part of debate team members or dancers so that's 0.39*41 = <<0.39*41=15>>15 students
16 students are soccer players and 15 are part of debate team members/dancers so 16+15 = <<16+15=32>>32 students will be leaving early
#### 32
